channel.title: 000webhost premium
channel.description: Okay, uhm... I'm trying to buy the silver plan so my MySQL can have remote connections, but every time I choose it it says it's $4.84/month and then when it goes to the next page and tells me the cost, it says it's $7.84/month. Any help? Also, I wanted the plan because I can't get remote connections to the MySQL database.

item.title: 000webhost premium
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Davidi2:

strange, probably something with the name servers. I was messing around with them for a project I am hosting

I have a question for the x10premium how do I add a domain to the hosting - since it says UNLIMITED DOMAINS -?

Read full topic

item.title: 000webhost premium
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

strange, probably something with the name servers. I was messing around with them for a project I am hosting

item.title: 000webhost premium
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:31, topic:396768”][quote author=sageofmali link=topic=493933.msg3612551#msg3612551 date=1306708545]

I’ve done quite a few different sites, haven’t worked on one for a while but I current have davidscape.org

Which is down :’( Well, am I allowed to have to domain hosts on my account? I made a ticket and they said something like terminating my current one. I put my forums on there first, and am now trying to put my hiscores website on there(The free hosted one).
[/quote]It’s not down for me

And I’m not sure about transferring, I’ve never done that before with them[/quote]It’s also down for me.

Read full topic

item.title: 000webhost premium
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

MistaBigBoss:

Question, the unlimited domains option described on the site, does it mean unlimited .coms, .orgs,… Or…?

Means you can have unlimited domains on the account.

[quote=“Davidi2, post:31, topic:396768”][quote author=sageofmali link=topic=493933.msg3612551#msg3612551 date=1306708545]

I’ve done quite a few different sites, haven’t worked on one for a while but I current have davidscape.org

Which is down :’( Well, am I allowed to have to domain hosts on my account? I made a ticket and they said something like terminating my current one. I put my forums on there first, and am now trying to put my hiscores website on there(The free hosted one).
[/quote]It’s not down for me

And I’m not sure about transferring, I’ve never done that before with them[/quote]
Davidscape.org doesn’t load goes to:

Oops! Google Chrome could not find davidscape.org
Try reloading: davidscape.­org
Additional suggestions:
Access a cached copy of davidscape.­org
Search on Google:

EDIT: It goes off and on.

Read full topic

Davidi2:

Glad you like it I’ve been using their free hosting for years, never had a problem

item.title: 000webhost premium
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

MistaBigBoss:

First of all, free webhosts are crappy, especially when it comes to updating your sites files so thats normal and try to delete your browser cache and then try again, second, since when does x10hosting allow free remote access?

It was because of the nameservers. Also, I’m not using the free version of x10hosting, I’m using x10premium, now. I liked it so much, I moved my original website from godaddy to there.

Read full topic

item.title: 000webhost premium
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:

item.title: 000webhost premium
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

I thought I made this thread? Lol… but, I’m going to try David’s option; he’s smart.
EDIT: I love you David! Works perfect.
EDIT 2: Okay, when I update it it takes a while to affect, and when I reload the page after it has been updated the css goes back to the old css. http://sshiscores.info Like every few minutes or so it’ll revert to the old css: Could it be when I changed the nameservers? I changed it to the x10hosting when I first posted THIS. So, I should wait 1-2 days for it to fix, right?

Read full topic

Yeah MBB, I just going to use I think until I get a paid webhost.

item.title: 000webhost premium
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:18, topic:396768”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=493933.msg3611294#msg3611294 date=1306613117]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=493933.msg3611275#msg3611275 date=1306611737]

[quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=493933.msg3611260#msg3611260 date=1306609846]
I used this site www.db4free.net to create a free remote connection supported MySQL database for the highscores of my game Vreggie Fish (not released yet) but then I found an highscore API that looked better so I stopped using the free database. I’m sure that you’ll be happy to use it so your welcome.
[/quote]so would this host vote4cash and highscores adequately? Is there a limit to use?
[/quote]This is what it says on the site, it is completely free and there is a size limit as far as I know, I don’t remember how much but I do remember it was enough for me to use it as a database for highscores.

By registering for a db4free.net account you agree that:

db4free.net is a testing environment
db4free.net is not suitable for production
if you decide to use your db4free.net database in production despite the warnings, you do that at your own risk (very frequent backups are highly recommended)
data loss and outages can happen at any time (any complaints about that will likely be ignored)
the db4free.net team is not granting any warranty or liability of any kind
the db4free.net team reserves the right to delete databases and/or accounts at any time without notice
it is up to you to get the latest information from the Forum and the db4free.net blog
db4free.net provides only a MySQL database, but no web space (there is nowhere to upload any files)
[/quote]I would hope the database speed is faster then what all of that sounds like :x Ill try it maybe. Thanks for the info MBB[/quote]This is only for amateurs, if you need something for a professional project that has to do with money, I’d go for a payed reliable database. Your welcome my friend.

Read full topic

db4free.net provides only a MySQL database, but no web space (there is nowhere to upload any files)[/quote]I would hope the database speed is faster then what all of that sounds like :x Ill try it maybe. Thanks for the info MBB

item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“sageofmali, post:15, topic:396768”]I know, but when I used the database connection from my computer, it worked fast.[/quote]So you’re saying that indeed it is a fucked up connection but when you use it it is not? That makes no sense.

item.title: 000webhost premium
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:13, topic:396768”][quote author=sageofmali link=topic=493933.msg3611302#msg3611302 date=1306613453]

[quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=493933.msg3611294#msg3611294 date=1306613117]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=493933.msg3611275#msg3611275 date=1306611737]

I used this site www.db4free.net to create a free remote connection supported MySQL database for the highscores of my game Vreggie Fish (not released yet) but then I found an highscore API that looked better so I stopped using the free database. I’m sure that you’ll be happy to use it so your welcome.
[/quote]so would this host vote4cash and highscores adequately? Is there a limit to use?
[/quote]This is what it says on the site, it is completely free and there is a size limit as far as I know, I don’t remember how much but I do remember it was enough for me to use it as a database for highscores.

By registering for a db4free.net account you agree that:

db4free.net is a testing environment
db4free.net is not suitable for production
if you decide to use your db4free.net database in production despite the warnings, you do that at your own risk (very frequent backups are highly recommended)
data loss and outages can happen at any time (any complaints about that will likely be ignored)
the db4free.net team is not granting any warranty or liability of any kind
the db4free.net team reserves the right to delete databases and/or accounts at any time without notice
it is up to you to get the latest information from the Forum and the db4free.net blog
db4free.net provides only a MySQL database, but no web space (there is nowhere to upload any files)

I used db4free.net, but the connection was slow: http://sshiscores.info
[/quote]Your wrong, I used it aswell and the connection was OK. I see that it takes longer to load your PHP than the loading of the actual database wich means the connection is due to your host and not due to db4free.net. If that site is yours.[/quote]
I know, but when I used the database connection from my computer, it worked fast.

Read full topic
